intro: Rhodognaphalopsis faroensis, commonly known as the Faroese stonecrop, is a flowering plant native to the Faroe Islands. It belongs to the family Crambeae and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in rocky, coastal environments and is adapted to harsh maritime conditions. Rhodognaphalopsis faroensis is an important component of the local flora, contributing to the unique biodiversity of the region.
